snippet: Dozens of bills opposed by Gov. Paul LePage have become law because he misinterpreted the Maine Constitution and did not veto them in time.
abstract: Maine Supreme Judicial Court overturns vetoes issued by Gov Paul LePage on dozens of bills, saying he misinterpreted state Constitution and issued them too late; bills will now become law by default, marking victory for legislative leaders in prolonged battle with LePage.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of bills opposed by Gov. Paul LePage have become law because he misinterpreted the Maine Constitution and did not veto them in time.

headline.main: Maine: Court Says Governor’s Vetoes Came Too Late
headline.print_headline: Maine: Court Says Governor’s Vetoes Came Too Late
